title: Back up suite data before upgrade
content:
To ensure a healthy backup, verify the environment.

Verify the environment before making a backup

To verify the healthy or not before making a backup, follow the following steps:

  1. Log in to the control panel or bastion node and run the following command to make sure all of the suite pods are ready. 
    kubectl get pod --all-namespaces|grep -v 1/1|grep -v 2/2|grep -v 3/3|grep -v 4/4|grep -v Completed

    This command returns a list of abnormal pods. When it returns no result, all of the suite pods are ready. If any pods can't run, see Troubleshoot installation.

  2. Clear your browser cache.
  3. Verify that you can log in to the Suite Administration interface: https://<external_access_host>/bo with the credentials below:
    • Username: suite-admin
    • Password: the password you set up in the installation process
  4. Verify that you can log in to the OMT Management Portal: https://<external_access_host>:5443 with the credentials below:
    • Username: admin
    • Password: the password you set up when running the bootstrap installation command

Before the version update, back up the suite data. You can use one of the following methods.

The method of using VM snapshots can be used for on-premises deployments only.

Back up suite data by taking VM snapshots

If you have the privileges and capability to take VM snapshots, perform the following steps to back up the suite data:

  1. Take a snapshot of each of the control plane nodes and worker nodes. For details, see the "Take a snapshot of the suite" topic.
  2. Back up the suite databases. For details, see the specific database documentation.
  3. Back up the suite's global and Smart Analytics NFS volumes. For details, see the "Suite backup procedure" topic.

Back up suite data using the suite disaster recovery solution

You can use the disaster recovery solution to back up the suite data. To back up the suite data, see the "Suite backup procedure" topic.
